node.title: Victorian hospitals already under strain ahead of expected COVID surge, government data shows
node.alt: Two PPE-clad health workers tend to patient on ventilator.
node.description: Tens of thousands more Victorians are ending up in hospital than this time last year and the length of stay has ballooned during the pandemic, data released by the state government reveals.
node.content:
["Tens of thousands more Victorians are ending up in hospital than this time last year and the length of stay has ballooned during the pandemic, data released by the state government has revealed.", "The latest health performance data comes ahead of an expected surge in hospitalisations as a result of COVID-19.", "The statistics from the June to September quarter show there were 500,735 patients admitted to hospital.", "The government said that was\u00a0up by more than 7,000 on the previous three months, and nearly 72,000 more admissions than the same period a year earlier.", "The effects of the influx have been felt in emergency departments, where 445,373 presentations were recorded during the same period \u2014 an increase of more than 83,000 than a year earlier.", "The release of the quarterly data comes amid warnings from the Australian Medical Association that the situation for the nation's hospitals is about to get \"much worse\".", "The association's\u00a0Public Hospital Report Card 2021, released today, highlights delays between requiring urgent care and receiving that treatment.", "There are also fears in Victoria about the state's under-pressure ambulance network, with lengthy delays and ramping at hospitals prompting a review of the call-out system.", "The health performance data shows there were 80,459 code 1 urgent calls over the September quarter, which is 11,792 more than a year earlier.", "Ambulances were at the scene within the benchmark of 15 minutes in only 73.5 per cent of cases. The average response time across the state was 13 minutes and 39 seconds.", "There was some improvement with the number of patients transferred from ambulances into hospital care within the benchmark 40 minutes \u2014 up to 67.1 per cent.", "The government said Ambulance Victoria was working with hospitals to implement a new protocol, where COVID-19 patients or suspected cases were transferred immediately.", "
Government boosts funding for beleaguered health network
", "The Victorian government will spend $307 million on preparing the state's public hospitals for an expected increase in COVID-19 patients.", "The money includes $87 million for hospital in the home programs, which is expected to free up about 100 hospital beds in Melbourne.", "There is also $42 million for extra staff to help keep people at home with extra medical and social supports.", "An additional $40 million dollars will be allocated for Ambulance Victoria to boost capacity.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
